What a fantastic idea! A s'mores-themed cake would be a perfect fit for your camping trip!

Now, let's get to some fun outdoor games and activities for your campsite:

1. **Campfire Scavenger Hunt**: Create a list of items that can be found around the campsite, like specific leaves, rocks, or birds. The first person to find all the items on the list wins!
2. **Glow-in-the-Dark Games**: Bring glow sticks or flashlights and play games like capture the flag, glow-in-the-dark Frisbee, or even a nighttime game of hide-and-seek.
3. **Outdoor Movie Night**: Set up a portable projector or a large screen and watch a favorite movie under the stars. You can even make it more special by making some popcorn over the campfire!
4. **Campfire Cooking Challenge**: Divide into teams and have a cook-off where you make your own camping-inspired dishes, like trail mix, s'mores, or campfire skillet meals. Judges can pick a winner based on taste, creativity, and presentation.
5. **Nature Art**: Collect natural materials like sticks, rocks, and leaves to create art pieces or sculptures around the campsite. You can even make a collaborative group project!
6. **Campfire Storytelling**: Gather around the campfire and take turns telling stories, sharing memories, or making up new tales together. You can even make it more exciting by using flashlights to create shadow puppets!
7. **Flashlight Tag**: A fun twist on traditional tag, where the person who's "it" uses a flashlight to chase the others around the campsite.
8. **Stargazing**: Spend some time gazing up at the stars, identifying constellations, and sharing myths and legends about the night sky.
9. **Campfire Music Session**: Bring instruments or have a sing-along around the campfire. You can even make up new camping-themed songs together!
10. **Nature Walks**: Take short walks around the campsite or nearby trails, exploring the local flora and fauna, and seeing what kind of wildlife you can spot.

These activities will add a lot of fun to your camping trip and create wonderful memories with your family. Don't forget to take plenty of photos to capture the moments!

Remember to always follow campsite rules and safety guidelines, and make sure to have plenty of s'mores ingredients on hand for your cake and snacking needs!
